DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if intensive lower extremity robotic therapy can improve gait speed and functional ambulation status in individuals 6 months or greater post-stroke.
DOC.brief_title: The General Use of Robots in Stroke Recovery: the Anklebot
DOC.criteria: 18 years of age or older First single focal unilateral lesion with diagnosis verified by brain imaging, which occurred at least 6 months prior Cognitive function sufficient enough to understand experiments and follow instructions Some amount of independent ambulation (with orthoses or walker) and a gait speed of at least 0.4m/s. Botox treatment within 6weeks of enrollment; Fixed contraction deformity in the affected limb; Complete and total flaccid paralysis of all lower extremity motor function; Unable to ambulate except with the aid of another person or ambulation speed of <0.4m/s
